config.paths:
This set of configuration values contains all the paths needed for Aerial to function.
The base directory for the project. This path MUST be absolute.
The base directory for the Aerial library. This path can be relative (to your base project path) or absolute.
The directory for the Aerial library folder. This path can be relative (to your base project path) or absolute.
The directory for the AMFPHP installation to use. This path can be relative (to your base project path) or absolute.
The directory for the Doctrine installation to use. This path can be relative (to your base project path) or absolute.
The directory for the Aerial web services. This path can be relative (to your base project path) or absolute.
config.code-generation:
This set of configuration values contains all the options involved in code generation.
The name of the base folder in which Aerial will generate code for PHP services.
The name of the base folder in which Aerial will generate code for ActionScript models and services.
The package string for Aerial to use in code generation which will be converted to a directory structure.
The name of the folder in which Aerial will place generated PHP Doctrine models.
The name of the folder in which Aerial will place generated PHP service files.
The name of the folder in which Aerial will place generated ActionScript Value-Object files (models).
The name of the folder in which Aerial will place generated ActionScript service files.
The package string to be used for the Aerial ActionScript bootstrapper file.
The name of the Aerial ActionScript bootstrapper file.
The suffix to use when Aerial is creating filenames for Value-Objects (models).
The suffix to use when Aerial is creating filenames for services.
The permission mode (octal) to use when Aerial creates directories.
The permission mode (octal) to use when Aerial creates files.
config.options:
This set of configuration values contains all the miscellaneous options involved in Aerial.
Turn this setting on to receive debugging information from Aerial in fault handlers.
The URL of the server.php (remote entry-point) file on the server.
Turn on this setting to receive ArrayCollections back from Aerial instead of simple arrays.
Turn on this setting to enable ACL (Access-Control-List) authentication.
The timezone setting for PHP
config.database:
The database connection settings. You can place several entries here but each must have a unique name.
The database engine.
The database host.
The database/schema name.
The database username.
The database password.
The database port.
